sen.j: 沼尻 小文吾（ぬまじり こぶんご、天保6年（1835年）? - 明治35年（1902年））は新選組隊士。
sen.e: Kobungo NUMAJIRI (1835?-1902) was a member of Shinsengumi (special police who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Kobungo NUMAJIRI (c.1835-1902) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special police force who guarded Kyoto during the end of the Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。統一用語に従いthe Tokugawa Shogunate、レビュー結果を参考にc.1835に変更しました。
sen.e: Kobungo NUMAJIRI (c.1835-1902) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special police force who guarded Kyoto during the end of the Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He became a corporal later.
He eventually became a corporal.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。
sen.e: He eventually became a corporal.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 生年は天保14年（1843年）説もある。
sen.e: Another brief goes that he was born in 1843.
Another brief states that he was born in 1843.
sen.cmt: statesの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: Another brief states that he was born in 1843.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 武州の出身とされるが、島田魁の『英名録』には上野国高崎藩の出身とある。
sen.e: It is said that he came from Bushu (Musashi Province), but "Eimeiroku" (a list of Shinsengumi members) by Kai SHIMADA reads that he came from the Takasaki Domain of Kozuke Province.
It is said that he came from Bushu (Musashi Province), but the "Eimeiroku" (a list of Shinsengumi members) made by Kai SHIMADA states that he came from the Takasaki Domain of Kozuke Province.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that he came from Bushu (Musashi Province), but the "Eimeiroku" (a list of Shinsengumi members) made by Kai SHIMADA states that he came from the Takasaki Domain of Kozuke Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 奥山念流剣術の遣い手。
sen.e: He mastered the swordsmanship of the Okuyama Nen-ryu school.
He mastered the swordsmanship of the Okuyama Nen-ryu school.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He mastered the swordsmanship of the Okuyama Nen-ryu school.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 両長召抱人に同姓の沼尻愛次郎がいるが別人。
sen.e: Aijiro NUMAJIRI, who was a page, is another person.
Aijiro NUMAJIRI (a page) had the same family name but was a different person.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。「同姓の」が訳もれです。
sen.e: Aijiro NUMAJIRI (a page) had the same family name but was a different person.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Kobungo joined Shinsengumi around October 1864.
Kobungo enrolled in the Shinsengumi around October 1864.

sen.j: 同年12月の編成では、尾形俊太郎の五番組に属している。
sen.e: Upon the allocation in December 1864, he belonged to the fifth squad led by Syuntaro OGATA.
In December 1864, he was assigned to the fifth squad led by Syuntaro OGATA.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。
sen.e: In December 1864, he was assigned to the fifth squad led by Syuntaro OGATA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）2月に、公金不始末で切腹となった勘定方の河合耆三郎の介錯を務める。
sen.e: In February 1866, he was instructed to assist the suicide of Accountant Kisaburo KAWAI, who was ordered to commit suicide by disembowelment because of embezzlement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In February 1866, he was in charge of assisting the suicide of the Accountant Kisaburo KAWAI, who was sentenced to commit suicide by disembowelment because for embezzlement.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため修正しました。スペースが２つ入っている箇所が２カ所あります。
sen.e: In February 1866, he was in charge of assisting the suicide of the Accountant Kisaburo KAWAI, who was sentenced to commit suicide by disembowelment because for embezzlement.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一回目は肩に当たり、二回目は斬り損ねて頭に当たり、三回目で漸く首を斬り落としたという。
sen.e: It is said that Kobungo missed the target by shoulder at first and by head in the second time and finally managed to cut Kisaburo's head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that he cut Kisabro's head in his third try after first hitting Kisaburo's shoulder and then, his head.

sen.e: It is said that he cut Kisabro's head in his third try after first hitting Kisaburo's shoulder and then, his head.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この時、「人間、あれ程悲しい声が出るとは思わなかった」と述懐したといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that Kobungo made a comment at that time, "I have never imagine people make such agonizing sound."

sen.e: It is said that Kobungo had said at the time: "I have never imagined people capable of making such agonizing sound."
